title: Definitions
context: PART I. DEFINITIONS, ADMINISTRATION [ยง844D-1] Definitions. In this chapter, unless a different meaning is plainly required: &ldquo;Autoradiograph&rdquo; means photographic film developed when exposed to radioactivity appearing as darkened areas which represents DNA sequencing resulting from analysis of samples and specimens. &ldquo;Buccal swab&rdquo; means a swab used to collect buccal cells from the mouth cavity by wiping the interior surface of the cheek. &ldquo;Conviction&rdquo; means a judgment on a verdict or a finding of guilty, or a plea of guilty or nolo contendere. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the police department of the city and county of Honolulu. &ldquo;DNA&rdquo; means deoxyribonucleic acid. &ldquo;DNA or forensic identification markers&rdquo; has the same meaning as &ldquo;profile&rdquo;. &ldquo;FBI&rdquo; means the Federal Bureau of Investigation. &ldquo;Print impression&rdquo; means any fingerprint, thumbprint, palm print, or set of fingerprints or palm prints designated in the department&rsquo;s rules or internal regulations adopted pursuant to section 844D-3. &ldquo;Profile&rdquo; means data resulting from scientific analysis of samples and specimens. &ldquo;Prosecuting attorney&rdquo; means an attorney from the department of the prosecuting attorney of any county, the department of the attorney general, or any other entity that prosecutes criminal cases. &ldquo;Sample&rdquo; means human biologic material collected in a manner specified in the department&rsquo;s rules or internal regulations adopted pursuant to section 844D-3, including but not limited to, saliva collected by means of buccal swab. &ldquo;Specimen&rdquo; means human biologic material collected in a manner specified in the department&rsquo;s rules or internal regulations adopted pursuant to section 844D-3, including but not limited to blood. [L 2005, c 112, pt of ยง1] Note Section 844D-3, referred to in the definitions of &ldquo;print impression&rdquo;, &ldquo;sample&rdquo;, and &ldquo;specimen&rdquo; does not exist.
